page.title: 11COMMUNICATIONS
page.content: Because of the scattered nature of the population of this area transport and communication pose their individual problems.Car ownership is extremely high, and it is not unusual for a family to own two or more vehicles. Often this is necessary as there is little public transport away from the main roads, and because of the distances involved and the open nature of the countryside, it is not always practical to use a bicycle.Micro-chip technology has been of great value in recent years enabling long distance field communications on the larger farms,and many farm vehicles are equipt with radios and telephones to enable their drivers to be in constant touch with their base.This saves much time and money.
